de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface CardReader


  • public interface CardReader
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    An instance of this class allows the direct access to a card reader. The card reader can be connected directly to the PC or wired indirectly via a controller hardware like an Artema controller.

    There are two ways to receive an instance of this class.

    • Use PaySession.getCardReader() to create an instance of this class, when the card reader is connected directly to the PC, without any intermediate controller hardware.
    • Use PayTerminal.getCardReader() when the card reader is wired to a controller hardware and you can only connect to the card reader via this controller.
    It is NOT recommended to use the CardReader constructor directly.

    The successfull creation of an instance of CardReader doesn't establish an exclusice access to the card reader. You have to connect() first.

    You must disconnect this exclusive connection by calling disconnect() before using another functionality of LUIS ePayment.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws PayException
        Establishes the communication to a card reader. This exclusive access has to be released by the disconnect() method.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws PayException
        Method to release the exclusive connection to the card reader. You can only access the card reader functionality, when you are connected. It is important to disconnect, when the cardReader is no longer needed or other functionality of LUIS ePayment have to be invoked.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Method to check, if a connection exists to a card reader. You can only access the card reader functionality, when you are connected. It is important to disconnect, when the cardReader is no longer needed or other functionality of LUIS ePayment have to be invoked.
        Returns:
        A flag, wheather an exclusive connection to the cardReader exists or not.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • expectCard

        boolean expectCard(int timeoutSec)
            throws PayException
        The card reader gets active and waits for a card to be inserted. This method terminates
        • when a card was inseretd in the card reader
        • when after the timeout (in sec) no card was inserred
        Returns:
        A flag, which signals an inseretd card (=true) or a timeout (=false).
        Throws:
        PayException

      • isCardInserted

        boolean isCardInserted()
                throws PayException
        Checks, if a card is currently in the card reader.
        Returns:
        true, if a card is in the reader, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • cardHasChip

        boolean cardHasChip()
        Checks, if the inserted card contains a chip.
        Returns:
        true, if a chip is detected on the card, false otherwise.

      • cardHasMagneticTracks

        boolean cardHasMagneticTracks()
        Checks, if the inserted card has magnetic tracks.
        Returns:
        true, if magnetic tracks are detected, false otherwise.

      • readMotorisedMagneticCard

        MagneticCard readMotorisedMagneticCard()
                                throws PayException
        Reads the content of the magnetic tracks of an inserted card and returns it. After this function, the card is still inserted into the card reader. Because not-motorised card readers read the magnetic tracks wile removing the card, this method is successfull only by motorised card readers.
        Returns:
        The contents of a card with magnetic tracks.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • readWhileEjectMagneticCard

        MagneticCard readWhileEjectMagneticCard()
                                 throws PayException
        Reads the content of the magnetic tracks of an inserted card and returns it. After this function, the card is ejected and not longer in the card reader. If a motorised card reader is available, use the readMotorisedMagneticCard method instead. The method terminates only, when the card is fully removed from the reader.
        Returns:
        The contents of a card with magnetic tracks.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • ejectCard

        void ejectCard()
        throws PayException
        Ejects a previously inserted card.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setRGB

        void setRGB(int colorRGB)
     throws PayException
        Some card readers have a build in LED and allow the access to this LED. This method sets the LED to the specified RGB value.
        Parameters:
        colorRGB - The color, the LED should change to.

        The value is 6-digit hexadecimal number.

        • The first 2 digits represent the RED value (range: 0x00 - 0xFF)
        • The next 2 digits are for the GREEN value (range: 0x00 - 0xFF)
        • The last 2 digits are the BLUE value (range: 0x00 - 0xFF)

        Samples:

        • red = 0xFF0000
        • green = 0x00FF00
        • yellow = 0xFFFF00
        Throws:
        PayException
